definition: to blend various types of wine (or spirits, or fruit juices etc)
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
to cash/to exchange/to add (liquid)/to blend/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing swamp/☱

sentences.english: The core procedure in the production of Site-flavour liquor is blending.
sentences.chinese: 特型白酒生產的核心部分是勾兌。

sentences.english: Blending of brandy in after appropriate containers harmonious 6 months to the bottle.
sentences.chinese: 勾兌後的白蘭地在適當的容器中和諧6個月就可裝瓶。

sentences.english: All sherry is made from wine fortified with brandy.
sentences.chinese: 所有的雪利酒都是在葡萄酒中加入白蘭地勾兌成的。

sentences.english: Are most Scotch whiskies blended or straight?
sentences.chinese: 大多數蘇格蘭威士忌都是勾兌的嗎？

sentences.english: After getting at the officials in charge, a shell company was finally awarded the highway contract.
sentences.chinese: 勾兌了負責官員後皮包公司終於拿到了高速公路合同。

sentences.english: The majority of all Scotch whiskies – including single malts – are blended.
sentences.chinese: 大多數蘇格蘭威士忌，包括純麥威士忌都是勾兌的。

sentences.english: Blending and flavor adjustment is the basis of improving Bandongjing liquor quality consistently.
sentences.chinese: 勾兌調味技術是穩定提高扳倒井酒質量的重要基礎。

definition: chicken bouillon powder (PRC)/essence of chicken, concentrated chicken stock sold as a tonic (Tw)
vermicelli made from mung bean starch etc
